I've found a bug! When you first download the app it starts downloading everything from you Google Drive to your PC, and if you interrupt this process before the it's finished, the next time you launch the app, it will think that the files it didn't download the last time have been deleted by you from you PC and it will proceed to delete them from you Google Drive, so that they will be lost forever. It's like the sync process is dangerously flawed.

I have trouble getting this to sync between my Linux systems. While it worked once on Ubuntu with GNOME, I could not get the same files to show up in Mint "Tricia". There doesn't seem to be a way of forcing it to refresh either. It's a shame because the set up and design is very intuitive. If there was a little more polish on this program, I'd give it 5 stars.

Thanks for a very good and useful app. Works fine for me. But I found 2 issues.

The app deserves the praises, as Google itself didn't provide an official Google Drive client for Linux. Other than that, it works, but requires some tweaks. Despite of checking the box "Launch on Startup", it never launched by itself in my Ubuntu 18.04, so no synchronization occurs till you manually start it (synchronization then gets noticeable in the System Monitoring and, in an old PC, the mechanical HD starts to spin harder right away). Very fortune that, upon these actions, it synchronizes because the SYNCHRONIZE button will only be available once in a life time: first access. After that, it wiĺl appear permanently unavailable followed by the unchangeable message "Already Synchronized".

All in all, not as described, light on features and bad overall implementation.

description: Never allowed me to connect (unsecure browser no matter which I used). Turns out I didn't need it. If in Ubuntu (GNOME), add Gmail to Online Account, enable "Files" and "Documents" sync, and boom, your files are accessible via File Explorer. No offline sync though.
It is stating that the browser is not secure or supported, this did used to work, which is a shame???
Cannot log in - unsupported browser
Old Browser validation fails

You don't get to pick and choose which files or folders to sync. This app will download your WHOLE Google Drive into the folder that you identify on your machine, and will update as the files change.

So if you have 15GB of data on Google Drive, Open Drive will download all 15GB onto your machine.

That defeats the purpose of having cloud storage. I am now maintaining two full sets of copies - one in the cloud and one on my machine.

This is useful if you use your Linux machine to backup your cloud drive and you have the space on your Linux machine to do that.
summary: Open Drive syncs your WHOLE Google Drive

При попытке зарегистрироваться Google пишет, что используется браузер, не отвечающий требованим безопасности.

Прочитал первых два комментария и не стал устанавливать это приложение. Намучаслся с другими вариантами и решил опробывать его. Работает как надо. Первый запуск программы был немного долгим. Секунд 30 в начале ничего не появлялось. Ставил на Ubuntu19.10

Возможно, этот браузер или приложение небезопасны. Подробнее…
